page.title: 03DONINGTON HAY DAY
page.content: bit of the mast when we went to visit it.Radio Lincolnshire was there and Sarah,Nicholas and I were interveiwed about our visit. {HAY DAY. { }Every year in Donington-on-Bain there is a Hay Day in aid of'Cancer Research'.There are pony rides,clay pigeon shooting,an art display from our school,coconut shy,birds of prey display,barbeque,steam engines,trade stalls,terrier racing,raffle,stocks and Smiths Nursery.It is very well supported by all the villages around. It is held in Mr.Brian Parkinsons field called 'The Park'.Mr Parkinson is a local farmer.It starts at 1o'clock and ends at 5.30pm.It costs 25p each.In 1985 it raised Â£735 altogether.Wards shop takes its van there to sell ice-creams and sweets to the people attending.
